item.title: Leslie add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "Life will break you. Nobody can protect you from that, and living alone won't either, for solitude will also break you with its yearning. You have to love. You have to feel. It is the reason you are here on earth. You are here to risk your heart. You are here to be swallowed up. And when it happens that you are broken, or betrayed, or left, or hurt, or death brushes near, let yourself sit by an apple tree and listen to the apples falling all around you in heaps, wasting their sweetness. Tell yourself you tasted as many as you could." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Rebecca West
item.description: "I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat, or a prostitute." -- Rebecca West

item.title: Leslie add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Leslie add a quote by John Donne
item.description: "No man is an island, entire of itself; every man is a piece of the continent, a part of the main. If a clod be washed away by the sea, Europe is the less, as well as if a promontory were, as well as if a manor of thy friend's or of thine own were: any man's death diminishes me, because I am involved in mankind, and therefore never send to know for whom the bells tolls; it tolls for thee." -- John Donne

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Leslie add a quote by John Dewey
item.description: "Education is not preparation for life; education is life itself." -- John Dewey

item.title: Leslie add a quote by John Dewey
item.description: "Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of imagination. " -- John Dewey

item.title: Leslie add a quote by John Dewey
item.description: "We only think when confronted with a problem." -- John Dewey

item.title: Leslie add a quote by John Dewey
item.description: "Failure is instructive. The person who really thinks learns quite as much from his failures as from his successes." -- John Dewey

item.title: Leslie add a quote by John Dewey
item.description: "Hunger not to have, but to be" -- John Dewey

item.title: Leslie add a quote by John Dewey
item.description: "The self is not something ready-made, but something in continuous formation through choice of action." -- John Dewey

item.title: Leslie add a quote by John Dewey
item.description: "To find out what one is fitted to do, and to secure an opportunity to do it, is the key to happiness." -- John Dewey

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Paulo Freire
item.description: "For apart from inquiry, apart from the praxis, individuals cannot be truly human. Knowledge emerges only through invention and re-invention, through the restless, impatient, continuing, hopeful inquiry human beings pursue in the world, with the world, and with each other." -- Paulo Freire

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Paulo Freire
item.description: "No one is born fully-formed: it is through self-experience in the world that we become what we are." -- Paulo Freire

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Paulo Freire
item.description: "The oppressors do not perceive their monopoly on having more as a privilege which dehumanizes others and themselves. They cannot see that, in the egoistic pursuit of having as a possessing class, they suffocate in their own possessions and no longer are; they merely have." -- Paulo Freire

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Paulo Freire
item.description: "Education either functions as an instrument which is used to facilitate integration of the younger generation into the logic of the present system and bring about conformity or it becomes the practice of freedom, the means by which men and women deal critically and creatively with reality and discover how to participate in the transformation of their world." -- Paulo Freire

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Paulo Freire
item.description: "Any situation in which some men prevent others from engaging in the process of inquiry is one of violence;â€¦ to alienate humans from their own decision making is to change them into objects." -- Paulo Freire

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Paulo Freire
